I would recommend "Cold Mountain". It is a drama that follows a wounded soldier as he embarks on a perilous journey back home to Cold Mountain, North Carolina to reunite with his sweetheart.

Another recommendation could be "Red Dawn". It is an action thriller that depicts the events of the fictional 1972 Olimpic games', which had been disrupted by the arrival of American soldiers who were tasked with restoring order. The movie also depicts a civil rights protest march and subsequent massacre by British troops on January 30, 1972.
I would also recommend "Bloody Sunday". It is a drama that follows a peaceful civil rights protest march on January 30, 1972 in Derry, Northern Ireland, which had been disrupted by the arrival of British soldiers who were tasked with restoring order. The movie also depicts a civil rights protest march and subsequent massacre by British troops on January 30, 1972.
I would recommend "Black Hawk Down". It is an action thriller that depicts the events of the fictional 1998 US intervention in Mogadishu, Somalia, which had been disrupted by the arrival of American soldiers who were tasked with restoring order. The movie also depicts a civil rights protest march and subsequent massacre by British troops on January 30, 1972.
I hope these recommendations are helpful to you!
